SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc42
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.network.interfaces

Interface RemoteServer

All Superinterfaces:
Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
ServerManager
public interface RemoteServer extends Remote
This interface describes the Server's behavior and is used to operate on the Server from a Client through a network connection. It contains all the necessary methods to execute actions and retrieve information.

  • Method Details

    • getAvailableGames

      ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> getAvailableGames() throws RemoteException
      Getter Method for the List of Available Games that a Player can join. The data is returned in an HashMap that uses String as a key and as a value: all data is written in the String format, including numbers, and all keys are String as well. Each HashMap contains the data of a single Game, and they are all contained in an ArrayList of HashMaps, so that one HashMap for every Game can be found. The data can be retrieved using the following Keys: - Name: the Game's name - NumberOfPlayers: the number of Players already inside it - Status: a String representation of the Game's GameStatus - NumberOfDisconnectedPlayers: the number of Players in the Game but disconnected, used to iterate through the next elements - DisconnectedPlayerX: the Disconnected Players' Nickname, so that the Client can determine if the User can re-join this Game or not. NOTE: There are multiple of them, starting from DisconnectedPlayer0 all the way to DisconnectedPlayerN, where N = NumberOfDisconnectedPlayers - 1.
      Returns:
      the List of Games
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • disconnectPlayer

      void disconnectPlayer(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Sets the Player as DISCONNECTED, allowing it to be skipped by the Turn System
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • rejoinGame

      void rejoinGame(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Sets the Player as NOT DISCONNECTED, allowing it to play again
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • kickPlayer

      boolean kickPlayer(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Removes the Player from the Game entirely
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicating if the removal was successful or not
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • playCard

      void playCard(int gameID, int playerID, int cardID, int x, int y) throws RemoteException
      Plays a Card from a certain Player in a specific set of Coordinates The Card to play is defined as the index of the Card in the Player's Hand. The Coordinates need to be in the Model's format
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      cardID - the index of the Card inside the Player's Hand [1, 2, 3]
      x - the x Coordinate where the Card will be placed
      y - the y Coordinate where the Card will be placed
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • flipCard

      void flipCard(int gameID, int playerID, int cardID) throws RemoteException
      Flips one of the Player's Cards
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      cardID - the index of the Card inside the Player's Hand [0, 1, 2]
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • drawCard

      void drawCard(int gameID, int playerID, CardType type) throws RemoteException
      Draws a Card from one of the 2 Decks and places it inside the Player's Hand
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      type - a CardType indicating from which Deck to draw [RESOURCECARD, GOLDCARD]
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • grabCard

      void grabCard(int gameID, int playerID, CardType type, int slot) throws RemoteException
      Grabs a Card from one of the 4 Slots and places it inside the Player's Hand
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      type - a CardType indicating from which Slots to grab [RESOURCECARD, GOLDCARD]
      slot - an int indicating which Slot in particular [1, 2]
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • lookupClient

      void lookupClient(int gameID, String ip, int port, String clientID) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException
      Sends a message to the Server, telling it how to contact the Client, so that it can save that information to reuse it when it will need to contact it again
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID to which the Client is subscribed
      ip - the Client's IP Address
      port - the Client's Port
      clientID - the String used for the Binding in the RMI Registry in RMI
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error
      NotBoundException - in case the Client can't be found

    • setPlayerStatus

      void setPlayerStatus(int gameID, int playerID, GameStatus status) throws RemoteException
      Setter Method for the Player's GameStatus
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      status - the GameStatus to set
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

      void setPlayerToken(int gameID, int playerID, Token token) throws RemoteException
      Setter Method for the Player's Token
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      token - the Token to set
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • setPlayerSecretObjective

      void setPlayerSecretObjective(int gameID, int playerID, int pickedCard) throws RemoteException
      Setter Method for the Player's Secret Objective. The Secret Objective is already stored inside the Model and IS NOT sent in here. The Player has 2 Temporary Secret Objectives: this method contains either 1 or 2, indicating which one to keep.
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      pickedCard - an int representing the User's choice [1, 2]
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • setPlayerStarterCard

      void setPlayerStarterCard(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Setter Method for the Player's Starter Card. The Starter Card is already inside the Model, in the temporaryStarterCard field. This method tells the Server to move it from there to the Player's PlayArea in (0, 0).
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • flipStarterCard

      void flipStarterCard(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Flips the Player's Temporary Starter Card
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • getDeck

      ArrayList<Card> getDeck(int gameID, CardType type) throws RemoteException
      Getter Method for the Decks.
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      type - a CardType indicating which Deck to return
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Card, containing all the Cards inside the Deck, in the same order
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • getSlotCard

      Card getSlotCard(int gameID, CardType type, int slot) throws RemoteException
      Getter Method for the Slots
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      type - a CardType indicating which Slots to consider [RESOURCECARD, GOLDCARD]
      slot - an int indicating which Slot to return [1, 2]
      Returns:
      a copy of the Card inside that Slot
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Communication Error

    • getPlayersInfo

      ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> getPlayersInfo(int gameID) throws RemoteException
      Getter Method for the Player's info. Each Player's info are contained inside an HashMap, and both Keys and Values are String. The HashMap are contained inside an ArrayList, so that there is an HashMap for each Player. The data can be retrieved with the following Keys: - Nickname: the Player's Nickname - Points: the Player's points - Token: a String representation of the Player's Token [RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW]
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      Returns:
      the Collection of data
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error

    • getPlayersHandSize

      int getPlayersHandSize(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException

      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Returns:
      the number of Cards inside the Player's Hand
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error

      a boolean value indicating if the Player is the first

      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error

    • getAvailablePlacements

      ArrayList<Coordinates> getAvailablePlacements(int gameID, int playerID) throws RemoteException
      Getter Method for the Available Placements. Returns an ArrayList of Coordinates, each indicating a position where a Card can be played inside the Player's PlayArea
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Coordinates
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error

    • canCardBePlayed

      boolean canCardBePlayed(int gameID, int playerID, int cardID) throws RemoteException
      Parameters:
      gameID - the Game's gameID
      playerID - the Player's playerID
      cardID - the index of the Card inside the Player's Hand [0, 1, 2]
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicating if the Card's cost requirements are satisfied and the Card can be played
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error

      a boolean value indicating if the Nickname is available or not
      Throws:

    • blockNickName

      void blockNickName(String nickname) throws RemoteException
      Blocks a Nickname, so that nobody else can use it
      Parameters:
      nickname - a String containing the Nickname
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a Network Connection Error
